subject: Re: [junit] How to install latest junit with maven2
msgSnippet: Just to get the jar all you have to do is reference junit in your pom in the scope test. When you build your project that JUnit jar will be automatically
messageBody:
Just to get the jar all you have to do is reference junit in your pom
in the scope test. When you build your project that JUnit jar will be
automatically downloaded to your repository. It is alos possible to do
this from ant using the maven andt-tasks

On Thu, Aug 21, 2008 at 7:28 PM, ben.aurel <ben.aurel@...> wrote:
> hi
> From what I've red in this list there are a few people that are
> installing junit with maven.
>
> I'd like to try it myself, but as a maven noob I can't find out how
> this is done.
>
> From the maven docs
>
> mvn install:install-file -Dfile=<path-to-file> -DgroupId=<group-id> \
> -DartifactId=<artifact-id> -Dversion=<version> -Dpackaging=<packaging>
>
> Looks a bit frightening ...
>
> Can somebody help me with this?
>
> thanks
> ben
>
>
